p: For some time, 13CO 2 has been used several times as a tool for the analysis of quantitative aspects of plant metabolism in whole plants including Nicotiana tabacum [ 45], Panax ginseng [ 39] and Pentalinon andrieuxii [ 53]. This tool allows central and secondary plant metabolic pathways to be elucidated under close to unperturbed in vivo conditions [ 42]. The detection of specific distributions of multiply labelled isotopologues in two monoterpenes form 13CO 2-labelled L. latifolia confirmed the validity of the experimental approach for the present study.
